result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armando L Moreno

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on January 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
filed by Atty Menden requesting an adjournment of the next hearing.
Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:01 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Armando L Moreno.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Menden advises that both her and her client believed the hearing was at 10:00 today, which is why her client has not appeared yet.  Atty. Menden believes discovery is still outstanding and as a result she would have been asking for a new court date.
State confirms they have reached out the the Department to seek the additional discovery and still have not received a response yet.  State is asking the matter be adjourned to allow them additional time to obtain the discovery.  Atty. Menden has no  objection.  Court will waive the defendant's appearance for today.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:55 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Armando L Moreno in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Armando L Moreno. Atty. Menden provides an update, she is still waiting on some additional discovery.  Atty. Menden requests a further proceedings date in about 45-60 days. No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:41 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Armando L Moreno in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden provides an update with regards to the defendant's treatment; she also notes she is waiting on some additional discovery so she is requesting another further proceedings date.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Eryn M Menden
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with R. Sanchez listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:49 PM Defendant Armando L Moreno in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
